content.text:
[@zach](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519)

I've been thinking about making a *super tiny* app for people to check under the hood for ssb-db, scuttlebot/ssb-server, or both, but I want to make sure it has a name that doesn't suck or ostracize people who aren't already developers. Here are some similar tools I can think of:

- Task Manager from Windows
- Activity Monitor from macOS
- System Monitor from GNOME
- Inspect Element/Developer Tools from browsers
- Django Admin (%3uZZQ2Ht6KAHpgoHaKGYht7wrRPClMVFjdawESvnyVA=.sha256)
- phpmyadmin
- [feedpunk](%ETdUKqd+6Ei8ayj1bRWhITl4G2KeVwf+8RhGhdo62s8=.sha256) 

Do you think something like "SSB Monitor" is intuitive, or are admin/monitor/etc just something I'm used to which makes it feel more neutral than it is? As we continue nailing down SSB bugs I think it will become increasingly important to have debugging tools that anyone can use, and I think starting out with a non-terrible name is probably a good call. I'd be super interested to hear your thoughts on this if you have time. âœ¨
